resources.string: Tell Chill Pepper, how are you feeling today:
begin this exercise by sitting upright
the nature of this exercise is equal breathing
breathe in through your nose for 4 counts
breathe out through your nose for 4 counts
repeat these steps until you feel \n calm enough to continue your day
begin this exercise by sitting upright and placing \n one hand on your tummy if you \n feel okay to do so

although posture is important for this 
 breathing technique, try to remain in 
 a position that is comfortable for 
 your body and soul
breathe in through your nose \n for two seconds then purse your \n lips and exhale for two seconds

try to direct all the motion 
 to your tummy moving 
 in an out while keeping your 
 chest as still as possible
repeat these steps until you feel \n calm enough to continue your day
7Cups is a free anonymous online chat service that connects you to an empathetic listener.
If you are experiencing suicidal thoughts, Crisis Services Canada can connect you to a trained responder through text or phone. They also have support services for anyone worried about a loved one.
A TED Talk about the massive positive impact that small interactions can have on the lives of others
A relaxing and meditative video depicting rock balancing
Slam poet encourages the audience to do good things, and change the world for the better
Advice on Getting Out Of a Funk
A professor uses an analogy about water bottles to explain how stress can impact us, and why it is so damaging in the long term
A video offering advice and perspective on surviving hard times and getting out of a rut

string-array.name: b1_arr
string-array.item: begin this exercise by sitting upright
the nature of this exercise is equal breathing
breathe in through your nose for 4 counts
breathe out through your nose for 4 counts
repeat these steps until you feel \n calm enough to continue your day

string-array.item: begin this exercise by sitting upright and placing \n one hand on your tummy if you \n feel okay to do so

although posture is important for this 
 breathing technique, try to remain in 
 a position that is comfortable for 
 your body and soul
breathe in through your nose \n for two seconds then purse your \n lips and exhale for two seconds

try to direct all the motion 
 to your tummy moving 
 in an out while keeping your 
 chest as still as possible
repeat these steps until you feel \n calm enough to continue your day
